abstract.p: Photo of interior at Maison 140, hotel in Beverly Hills (Currents: Los Angeles)

block.p: A spiffy new bed-and-breakfast-scale hotel, Maison 140 (at 140 Lasky Drive), in Beverly Hills, has been created by the team that designed the nearby Avalon Hotel. Kelly Wearstler, of Kelly Wearstler Interior Design, has transformed a 1930's hotel with a spin on French chinoiserie. Black corridors, fire-engine red walls, patterned wallpapers and ornamental furnishings offer a surprising visual jolt. The lobby, above, has white lacquer tables and a banquette by Ms. Wearstler's company, along with red enamel plates decorating the wall. Reservations: (800) 432-5444; rates for small rooms (12 by 17 feet on average, including bathroom) start at $140 a night.
